article iii  control of livestock distance requirements for keeping cows no person shall keep or milk more than one cow at any one place within the corporate limits of the city which place is located closer than 100 feet to a house on the adjoining property except that calves under six months of age when kept with their mothers shall not be included this section shall not apply to cows kept on acreage for which a permit has been secured from the city commission to keep same within the city limits such permit may be granted by the city commission without cost upon written application therefor and shall be revocable at the will of the city commission on its own motion  dairy stables for more than one cow it shall be unlawful for any person to build erect establish operate or maintain within the limits of the city any dairy or cow stable where more than one cow is kept or milked without first obtaining a permit therefor from the city commission  keeping of horses mules jacks jennets goats sheep or bulls at one place it shall hereafter be unlawful for any person to keep or maintain at one place within the limits of the city any one or more of the following animals horses mules jacks jennets goats sheep and bulls this section shall not apply to livestock kept on acreage for which a permit has been secured from the city commission to keep same within the city limits such permit may be granted by the city commission without cost upon written application therefor and shall be revocable at the will of the city commission on its own motion  disturbances by stabled animals any person who shall stable or keep a horse mule or any other animal in the city limits in such a manner that said animal by stamping or kicking creates such a noise as shall be a disturbance to those living in the vicinity shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor  breeding it shall be unlawful to breed permit or cause to be bred any livestock within the corporate limits of the city  tying on lots any person who shall stake tie or hobble any animal whatsoever on any lot of which he is not the owner or on any lot or block within the city limits in such a manner as to allow such animals to go upon the adjacent sidewalk or street shall be guilty of an offense  hitching to trees in streets or public places any person who ties or fastens any animal to any shade tree or to the box around any tree planted or growing in any street or public place shall be guilty of an offense  display or sale of livestock on streets it shall be unlawful for any person to use any street of the city as a place on which to display horses or other livestock for sale or to sell the same on said street in any manner that will create an annoyance or which will create any inconveniences or nuisances to the public in the free and uninterrupted use of said street or streets  breaking horses or mules on streets any person who breaks or attempts to break upon the streets or who exercises in harness or attempts to exercise in harness any wild or unruly horse or mule upon the streets shall be guilty of an offense  horse racing in streets etc any person who shall run or be in any way concerned in running any horse race in along or across any public square or street in this city shall be guilty of an offense  running at large the running at large of horses mules jacks jennets cattle sheep goats bulls and hogs within the city limits is hereby declared to be a nuisance and shall be unlawful and constitute a misdemeanor  duty of officers to impound it shall be the duty of the chief of police or any police officer of the city to cause all animals running at large in violation of this article to be impounded  right to redeem the person entitled to the possession of any animal impounded by the city upon proper application shall be entitled to possession of such animal provided he has paid the city an impounding fee for each animal redeemed and has paid any and all expense incurred by the city due to the impounding of said animal the impounding fee shall be in an amount as established by the city commission from time to time  keeping of hogs and goats and sheep it shall hereafter be unlawful for any person to keep or maintain within the limits of the city one or more hogs swine pigs or goats  provided that this section shall not apply to milch goats for which a permit has been secured from the city health officer to keep same within the city limits which permit shall be revocable by the city health officer at any time the premises upon which such goats are not maintained in a sanitary condition this section shall not apply to hogs and goats kept on acreage for which a permit has been secured from the city commission to keep same within the city limits such permit may be granted by the city commission without cost upon written application therefor and shall be revocable at the will of the city commission on its own motion  temporary possession nothing in this article shall prohibit the temporary possession of livestock in the hands of packing houses or other slaughter houses nor shall this article prohibit the temporary exhibition of livestock at stock shows however these exemptions shall not relieve the persons in charge of such livestock from the operation of other laws and ordinances of the city relative to the sanitary conditions and the noise from said livestock    secs 676693  reserved article iv  wild animals when unlawful to keep wild animals it shall be unlawful within the city limits for any person to possess keep permit suffer cause or allow any wild animal within any residence or within 300 feet of any residence or building used for human habitation  wild animal defined the term wild animal means and includes any mammal amphibian reptile or fowl which is of a species which is wild by nature and of a species which due to size vicious nature or other characteristic is dangerous to human beings such animals include but are not limited to lions tigers leopards panthers bears wolves raccoons skunks whether deodorized or not apes gorillas monkeys of a species whose average adult weight is ten pounds or more foxes elephants rhinoceroses alligators crocodiles and all forms of poisonous reptiles the term wild animals does not include gerbils hamsters guinea pigs mice or rabbits  violation and penalty any person who shall possess keep permit suffer cause or allow any wild animal within any residence or within 300 feet of any residence or building used for human habitation in violation of this article shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined in accordance with the general penalty provision found in section 16 each day any such violation of this article occurs shall constitute a separate offense further the keeping of more than one of such wild animals in violation hereof shall be a separate offense for each such wild animal  impoundment of wild animals the animal control officer shall seize all animals found in violation of this article and impound all such animals at the city pound or such place as is suitable the animal control officer or any police officer or any employee of the city as may be designated by the animal control officer shall have the right to enter any building to seize such wild animal in violation of this article upon the consent of any adult occupant of such building or the owner of such building or such person who has the right of possession of such building or under a warrant issued by a magistrate  redemption of impounded animals upon a showing to the animal control officer or his authorized representative of clear and convincing proof of right of possession of any such impounded animal such person may redeem such animal within seven days of the date of impoundment upon payment of the fees set out in section 699 provided that 1 such animal is not infected or believed to be infected with rabies or any other disease 2 such person submits to the animal control officer a sworn affidavit setting out the location where the wild animal will be kept and that he will not permit suffer cause or allow such animal to be within any residence or within 300 feet of any residence in the city  impoundment fees the fees as provided for in the fee schedule shall be charged for impoundment and boarding of wild animals  disposition of unredeemed animals if such wild animal is not redeemed within seven days of the date of initial impoundment the animal control officer shall be authorized to offer such animal to any public zoo or medical institutions using such animals for research if such wild animal is not accepted by such public zoo or medical institution within 30 days of the date of initial impoundment the animal control officer is hereby authorized to destroy any such animal  applicability of article the provision of this article shall not apply to the keeping of wild animals for treatment in a facility open and operated by a veterinarian licensed by the state  use of live vaccine prohibited no person shall vaccinate or attempt to vaccinate any wild animal against rabies by the use of live vaccine  possession of animals vaccinated with live vaccine prohibited no person shall possess keep permit or allow any wild animal within the city if such animal has been vaccinated against rabies with the use of live vaccine  secs 61046120  reserved article v  dog park footnotes  3  editors note resolution no r02201  14 adopted jan 5 201 did not specify manner of building or structure shall be constructed altered or removed nor shall the equipment for the operation of a building structure or premises be constructed installed altered or removed except in providing standards for repair vacation or demolition  setting forth the administrative responsibility in such matters  and providing a penalty for violation of such standards 1 defects all buildings or structures which have any or all of the following defects shall be deemed dangerous buildings a those whose interior walls or other vertical structural members list lean or buckle to such an extent that a plumb line passing center of gravity falls outside of the middle third of its base b those which exclusive of the foundation show 33 percent or more of damage or deterioration of the supporting members or 50 percent of damage or deterioration of nonsupporting enclosing or outside walls or covering c those which have improperly distributed loads upon the floors or roofs or in which the same are overloaded or which have insufficient strength to be reasonably safe for the purpose used d those which have been damaged by fire wind or other causes so as to have become dangerous to life safety morals or the general health and welfare of the occupants or the people of the city e those which are so dilapidated decayed unsafe unsanitary or which so utterly fail to provide the amenities essential to decent living that they are unfit for human habitation or are likely to cause sickness or disease so as to work injury to the health morals safety or general welfare of those occupying such building f those having light air and sanitation facilities which are inadequate to protect the health morals safety or general welfare of human beings who live or may live therein g those which have inadequate facilities for egress in case of fire or panic or those having insufficient stairways elevators fire escapes or other means of communication h those which have parts thereof which are so attached that they may fall and injure members of the public or property i those which because of their condition are unsafe unsanitary or dangerous to the health morals safety or general welfare of the people of this city j those buildings existing in violation of any provisions of this the building code or other ordinances of this city 2 standards for repair vacation or demolition a the following standards shall be followed in substance by the building inspectors and the building official in ordering repair or vacation or demolition 1 if the dangerous building can reasonably be repaired so that it will no longer exist in violation of the terms of this subsection it shall be ordered repaired 2 if the dangerous building is in such condition as to make it dangerous to the health morals safety or general welfare of its occupants it shall be ordered to be vacated b in any case where a dangerous building is 50 percent damaged decayed or deteriorated it shall be repaired or demolished in all cases where a building cannot be repaired so that it will no longer exist in violation of the provisions of this subsection it shall be demolished in all cases where a dangerous building is a fire hazard existing or erected in violation of the terms of this subsection or of this or of the building code or of any other ordinance or of any other requirement of law of the state it shall be repaired or demolished 3 dangerous buildings  nuisances all dangerous buildings within the terms of subsection b1 of this section are hereby declared to be public nuisances and shall be thereof shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined in accordance with the general penalty provision found in section 16 each day such violation continues to exist shall constitute a separate offense    secs 10681090  reserved article iv  mobile homes footnotes  3  state law reference texas manufactured housing standards act texas occupations et seq  regulation by municipality of mobile and manufactured housing texas occupations   regulation of certain types of housing and buildings reservation of municipal authority texas occupations codes adopted the texas mobile home standards act including the rules and regulations adopted by the mobile home division of the texas department of labor and standards a copy of which is on file with the city secretary is hereby adopted by the city and is incorporated in this reference herein for all purposes    administrative enforcement the purpose of this article is to provide basic and uniform regulations and performance objectives establishing reasonable standards and safeguards for the safety health and welfare of the occupants and users of mobile homes which shall be designed and constructed to comply with the provisions herein set forth and the parking and location of mobile homes in said city this article is hereby declared to be remedial and shall be construed to secure the beneficial interest and purpose thereof which will be health sanitation general public safety and welfare by regulating the location installation construction and maintenance of all mobile homes  scope this article provides the minimum standards with respect to strength durability corrosive resistance fire resistance and other qualities for materials assemblies construction and equipment also regulated under the provisions of this article are the use and occupancy of mobile homes and the licensing thereof and permits and fees prefabricated and modular buildings other than mobile homes are not regulated by the provisions of this article but are regulated by other code provisions and ordinances    definitions unless otherwise specified regulation of mobile homes herein shall be equally applicable to those structures classified as hudhomes and said terms shall be interpreted as being interchangeable  restrictions and zoning the provisions of this article shall not be deemed or construed to repeal modify or constitute an exception to any fire zone restrictions zoning ordinance deed restrictions or restrictive covenants running with the land no mobile home shall be parked placed or permitted to remain on any lot or tract of land in the city in violation of the zoning ordinance of the city any deed restrictions or restrictive covenants running with the land any permit or license issued hereunder for the placement of a mobile home upon any lot or tract in the city in violation of any zoning ordinance deed restrictions or restrictive covenants running with the land shall be null and void and of no effect    maintenance and existing location of mobile homes mobile homes located within the city limits at the time of the passage of this article may continue to be so located and their occupancy continued if such use of occupancy was legal at the time of the passage of this article and further provided that such continued use conforms to all requirements herein and is not dangerous to life the replacement relocation or rearrangement of a mobile home shall not be permitted unless such permission is granted under the provisions of this article this prohibition specifically includes replacement of a mobile home with a hudhome all mobile homes both existing and new and all parts thereof shall be maintained in a safe and sanitary condition all devices or safeguards which are required by this article shall be maintained in good working order    placement of mobile homes prohibited it shall be unlawful to place any mobile home as opposed to a manufactured home in the city manufactured homes shall be allowed upon compliance with all relevant provisions of this article those mobile homes now present in the city shall be unaffected by this section however said mobile homes may not be moved to any new location in the city  duties and powers of director of public works the director of public works and his authorized representatives shall enforce all the provisions of this article and shall act on any question relative to the mode or manner of construction and the materials to be used in the erection addition to alteration repair removal location occupancy and maintenance of mobile homes except as may otherwise be specifically provided for by statutory requirements or as herein provided 1 applications and permits the director of public works shall receive applications and issue permits for the placement and alteration of mobile homes and inspect the premises for which such permits have been issued and enforce compliance with the provisions of this article 2 building notices and orders the director of public works shall issue all necessary notices or orders to remove illegal or unsafe conditions to ensure compliance with all the requirements of this article for safety health and general welfare of the public 3 compliance with state law all mobile homes constructed within the state or imported into the state after the effective date for compliance with the provisions of texas occupations shall have a label or mark of compliance permanently affixed certifying compliance with the standards and provisions of said law the city shall have the right to inspect all mobile homes for the purpose of determining that they are maintained so as to comply with the provisions of said state law and the city shall further have the right to inspect for safety and for compliance with the provisions of this article all mobile homes whether constructed prior to or subsequent to the effective date of said texas occupations 4 test reports the director of public works may accept reports from recognized testing laboratories which have complied with the professional licensing laws of the state of the domicile if any with respect to new materials and methods of construction purposes for use and which are not specifically provided for in this article when such report certifies that such material or method of construction equals or exceeds the performance standards required by the provisions of this article the cost of all such tests or other investigations required under this provision shall be paid for by the applicant  placement and compliance permit a generally no mobile home shall be placed on any lot or site in the city unless a permit therefor has been issued by the city approving said placement said placement permit shall not become final and absolute until said director of public works inspects said mobile home in place and certifies on said placement permit that said mobile home in place is in compliance with the terms of this article said mobile home owner or occupant shall have 20 days to secure the certification of compliance after the mobile home has been placed on a lot in the city no placement permit will be issued until an affidavit has been submitted to the city stating that the purpose for which the permit is being sought will not violate this article the city zoning ordinance any deed restrictions or covenants running with the land to which the property may be subject the city shall not issue a permit fee required herein until the owner or occupant of said mobile home has paid said fee as provided for in the fee schedule b outside licensed parks it shall be unlawful for any person to locate or maintain for occupancy any mobile home or travel trailer in the city other than in a duly licensed and lawful mobile home park or travel trailer park unless application is made as hereinafter provided 1 private lots persons desiring to place a mobile home for occupancy on a private lot whether said lot is vacant or has improvements thereon shall first secure a permit from the city by filing a written application for such permit with the city secretary giving the name and address of the applicant size of the mobile home and a description of the property upon which said mobile home is to be located 2 when permits may be issued a thereafter it shall be the duty of the public works director city building official or city engineer and city secretary to submit said application to the city commission at its first regularly scheduled meeting after the submission of the said application to him the city commission may refuse to grant any such permit unless the applicant shall first show to the satisfaction of the city commission that such applicant can and will comply with the requirements of the uniform mobile home texas mobile home standard act and other applicable ordinances further no permit will be issued to any applicant unless he shall also show to the satisfaction of the city commission that 1 such mobile home will be located at least 25 feet from any property boundary line abutting upon a public street or highway and at least ten feet from any other property boundary lines 2 such mobile home will not be located closer than 50 feet from any building or residence 3 the location of such mobile home is not in violation of any deed restrictions or covenants running the land 4 the location of such mobile home is not within any area zoned for oresidential bresidential cresidential duplex or dapartment as set forth in the zoning ordinance of the city 5 the applicant has submitted tiedown and foundation plans which meet the approval of the citys public works department b if the city commission is satisfied that such application should be granted the city commission shall issue a permit allowing the mobile home to be located as requested there shall be no charge for the permit issued under this subsection 3 unlawful to maintain mobile home without permit or license it shall otherwise be unlawful for any person to maintain or allow to be maintained on any premises owned by them or under their control within the corporate limits of the city any mobile home or travel trailer for occupancy upon the tract on which it rests without first obtaining a permit or a license as the case may require from the city c penalty any person who violates any provision of this section shall be guilty of a class c misdemeanor and shall be fined in accordance with the general penalty provision found in section 16 further each day shall constitute a separate violation and the person in violation shall be fined for each day such violation occurs      mobile home tiedown all mobile homes located within the city limits shall be provided with tiedowns the mobile home shall be anchored to resist the overturning or sliding due to wind anchors or tiedowns such as castinplace concrete dead men eyelets imbedded in concrete screw augers or arrowhead anchors shall be placed at least at each corner of the mobile home each device shall be able to sustain a minimum load of 4800 pounds  slabs required all mobile homes moved into the city limits after the passage of this article shall be provided with sixinch reinforced concrete slabs the same size or larger than the mobile home placed on said lot  skirts required all mobile homes shall have installed within 20 days from the time said mobile home is moved on said lot skirts of metal brick or masonry construction extending from the slab to the lower frame of said mobile home in the event that mobile homes are located in the city prior to the passage of this article without slabs skirts of metal brick or masonry construction shall be installed extending from the ground surface to the lower frame of said mobile home in the event there is no slab  other requirements no mobile home shall be placed on a lot in the city that has an existing residential or commercial building on said lot all mobile homes located in the city shall be required to have their own separate water and sewer connections  appeals any appeals which a person desires to make based upon the refusal of the city to issue permits or based upon an inspection disapproval or any conditions required by this article shall be made to the city commission  compliance violations and penalties when any person shall have been notified by a written notice issued by the city that a mobile home located in the city is in violation of this article he shall commence immediately to abate the violation within the time specified in the written notice such time shall not exceed ten days and may provide for immediate compliance when a serious threat to life or substantial damage to property may be involved    secs 1010610123  reserved article v  house moving definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning house means any building or structure used or designed to be used for human habitation or occupancy in any manner or for any purpose house moving means the transportation of a house from place to place along or across any public street within the corporate limits of the city  permits a any person firm partnership or corporation desiring to move any house shall prior to beginning work apply to the city secretary for a permit showing the present location of the house the new location the proposed route of moving the size and type of construction of the house and such other information as may be required and shall pay a deposit per square foot outside measurement for each structure to be moved the deposit shall be in an amount as established by the city commission from time to time the permit shall show 1 the name of the person firm partnership or corporation who will move the house 2 the name of the owner of the house 3 the present location of the house 4 the proposed new location 5 the route of moving as approved by the traffic engineer 6 the exact date and time during which the house will occupy the street 7 the time that the house is allowed to remain in the street 8 the size and type of construction of the house 9 evidence that arrangements have been made with utility companies andor the city where necessary to prevent damage thereto 10 the receipt of the permit deposit 11 the business address and home address of the applicant 12 furnish proof of liability insurance in a reputable insurance company to protect the public and the city from any damage caused by the applicant in moving the house for which the permit is requested when the house moving operation is completed and the city street and bridge superintendent has given the city secretary the assurance that no damage to life or property has been caused the required deposit shall be reimbursed or returned to the applicant b each permit shall be issued in duplicate and one copy posted on the house to be moved c the maximum time during which a house may legally remain in a street under a permit shall be 48 hours d during the entire time that the house is occupying the street or any portion of same the mover shall keep it continuously in motion toward its destination and shall not allow the work or moving to stop during such time e the chief of police shall have authority to establish and direct as a condition to the issuance of the permit the time when the house moving shall start and the time when it shall be completed the routes over which houses of specified dimensions may be moved and such other regulations and conditions which he may deem necessary and deviation therefrom shall constitute an offense  notification of chief of police the city secretary shall immediately upon issuance of the permit notify the chief of police stating the route when moving will begin and end and the number of days allowed  notice of completion whenever the holder of the permit has completed the work of moving a house under a permit he shall promptly notify the city secretary of such fact the city secretary shall cause an inspection to be made of the route of moving and the installation of the house if the holder of the permit has caused damage to the streets curbs gutters sidewalks or other public property the holder of the permit shall be notified of such fact specifying the damage by mailing to him a written notification by certified mail at either the business or home address listed in the application for the permit the holder of the permit shall proceed within two days from the date of such notification to begin the work of repairing the damage and completing the same to the satisfaction of the city  utility lights poles etc a it shall be unlawful for the holder of the permit to disconnect any electric light and power connection gas connection water connection or telephone connection from any house which he proposes to move without the consent of the public utility owning such connection b it shall be unlawful for the holder of the permit to remove tear down or destroy any pole or wire or other property belonging to the city or to any utility company furnishing gas electric light and power telephone or telegraph or to any railway company without the consent of such utility or other person owning the same  secs 1012910154  reserved article vi  streets and parking division 1  generally offstreet parking regulations reserved article vii  alarm system installation and maintenance footnotes  4  state law reference municipal regulation of alarm systems texas local government et seq definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alarm site means the specific property or area of the premises upon or within which an alarm system is or is to be installed alarm system means any device used to detect or prevent burglary theft shoplifting pilferage or other such emergency situations which when activated caused notification to be made directly or indirectly to the police department or any device or system designed primarily for the purpose of giving an audible or visual signal of an attempted burglary theft shoplifting pilferage or other such emergency an alarm system shall not include 1 an alarm installed on a motor vehicle 2 an alarm designed so that no notification is given to the police until after the occupants or an agent of the owner or lessee have checked the alarm site and determined that there is physical evidence at the site showing that the alarm was the result of criminal activity of the find for which the alarm system was designed to give notice if a person who is able to grant access to the alarm site remains at such site until police arrive whenever the police are notified after an alarm has been activated and such person renders access and such other assistance as he is able to give and that is needed by the police to properly investigate the situation 3 an alarm installed upon premises occupied by the united states government the state the city or any county governments situated within the corporate limits of the city 4 any device or system designed solely to detect or give notice of fire or smoke alarm system business means any person who installs services or responds to alarm systems for remuneration automatic dialing device means any device connected to an alarm system which automatically sends a prerecorded message or coded signal indicating the activation of the alarm system to a predetermined location burglar alarm means any device intended to prevent or detect an unauthorized entry or attempted unauthorized entry into the alarm site central station means that part of an alarm system business which intercepts signals indicating the activation of an alarm device and which relays this information by live voice to the police department false alarm means any alarm which was not the result of an emergency or threat of emergency of the kind for which the alarm system was designed to give notice holdup alarm means any device activated by human action as a result of robbery or attempted robbery at or of the alarm site local alarm means any alarm emitting audible andor visual signals in at or on the alarm site when activated and which causes notification to be made directly or indirectly to the police department permit means a certificate license permit or other form of permission that authorizes a person to engage in an action permit holder means the individual corporation partnership or other legal entity to whom an alarm permit is issued person means any individual partnership corporation or other legal entity tax assessor and collector means the tax assessor and collector of the city or his authorized representative telephone answering service means any business other than an alarm system business which intercepts signals indicating the activation of an alarm system and which relays this information by live voice to the police department thirty minute shutoff means an automated device associated with a local alarm which automatically causes the alarm to shut off and discontinue the emission of an audible signal after a period of time not to exceed 30 minutes of continuous operation    1 permit required  exceptions  number a no in control of the property shall ensure that the alarm system is repaired within 72 hours of the time notification that such system is malfunctioning is given in writing on a form designated by the police department to him or to his employee or his agent by a member of the police department designated by the chief of police to give such notices b the person in control of the property may cause such system to be deactivated rather than having such system repaired if he so desires if he does deactivate such system rather than ensuing it to be repaired such system shall not be reactivated until is has been repaired    11 duty of person notified by police department to provide access to premises render assistance any person who is notified by any member of the police department of the activation of an alarm system and who is able to give access to the alarm site shall come to the alarm site within one hour of the time such person is notified of such activation and shall provide the police department any necessary access or assistance    12 operation of alarm system no person shall install cause to be installed or permit to be installed any alarm system unless the requirements of this article are met 1 any alarm system which may be activated as a result of different types of emergency situations shall give a unique signal to designate activation as a result of a holdup a burglary a fire or any other different type of emergency situation so that the proper notification and proper response can be made  2 any local alarm system shall have a 30minute shutoff and must not make a sound similar to that of a siren or any emergency vehicle or similar to a civil defense warning system  3 no holdup alarm shall include a money clip pressure pad or similar device which can cause activation inadvertently  and any holdup alarm shall be designed so that it may be activated only be intentional and deliberate human action  4 no person shall use or permit the use of any telephone device or telephone attachment which automatically selects any telephone line lending into the communication center of the police department of any number leading into the offices of the city and then transmits any prerecorded message or signal  5 no person shall use or permit the use of any system which gives notification of the activation of an alarm system directly to the police department by any means other than live human voice  and 6 the chief of police may set reasonable standards and procedures to be followed by any alarm system business or telephone answering service when given notice to the police department of activation of an alarm system such standards and procedures shall be set out in writing and made available to any alarm system business or telephone answering service requesting same    13 registration of alarm system business with police department a new business prior to doing business within the city an alarm system business shall register with response to alarm a the person in control of the property on which an alarm system is installed will be charged the full costs incurred by the city when he his agent or his employee intentionally or knowingly activated the alarm system for any reason other than an emergency or threat of an emergency of the kind for which the alarm system was designed to give notice the city commission finds that the minimum costs incurred by the city in responding to the activation of alarm system as provided for in the fee schedule shall be charged the person in control of the property whenever he his employee or his agent intentionally or knowingly activates an alarm system for any reason other than an emergency or threat of an emergency of the kind for which the alarm system was designed to give notice and the city responded to such activation of the alarm system such charge shall be a minimum charge only and shall not be applicable when a tabulation of costs including overhead the cost of investigation and all costs incident to the response to a particular alarm system show that the cost was greater b unless full costs are chargeable under subsection a of this section the fees as provided for in the fee schedule shall be charged the permit holder for each response by the city to notification of activation of an alarm system in excess of five alarms from the same alarm system within a 12month period    20 compliance with state law all person subject to the provisions of the private investigators and private security agencies act of the state texas occupations et seq are required to comply with all applicable provisions of that act    21 violations  penalties each permit holder and each person having control over property on which an alarm system is installed has an affirmative duty to comply with all provisions of this article and it shall not be a defense to prosecution of such a person that he was acting without a culpable mental state    22 revocation of permit  reasons a permit for an alarm system may be revoked if mechanical malfunction or faulty equipment has caused five or more false alarms by such alarm system in the 12month period immediately preceding the date of notice of a hearing for the purposes of this article the terms mechanical malfunction and faulty equipment shall not relate to be false alarms caused by human error or an act of god a permit shall not be revoked if the permit holder shows that since the most recent false alarm from such alarm system the system has been repaired and the police department has inspected such alarm system and found it to have been properly repaired    23 revocation of permit  notice  hearing a prior to revocation of a permit for an alarm system written notice shall be given to the permit holder such notice shall set forth 1 the specific dates on which there have been false alarms from such alarm system which were caused by mechanical malfunction or faulty equipment 2 that a hearing will be held before the tax assessor and collector or his designated representative to determine whether the permit for such alarm system should be revoked 3 the date time and place of such hearing 4 that the permit holder may appear in person andor be represented by counsel may present testimony and may cross examine all witnesses b all hearings shall be held by the tax assessor and collector or his designated representative such official shall be referred to as the hearing officer the tax assessor and collector shall not designate any person to perform the duties of hearing officer under this article if it is shown that the person in question has participated in the investigation of false alarms from the alarm site in question or has prior knowledge of the allegations or circumstances discovered in such investigation such person designated as hearing officer may prior to the hearing receive a copy of the notice given to the permit holder c a representative of the legal department shall be present at such hearing to advise the hearing officer as to procedural matters  however such attorney shall not partake in any determination of the facts d all hearings shall be conducted under rules consistent with the nature of the proceedings  provided however the following rules shall apply to such hearings 1 all parties shall have the legal right to representation by a licensed attorney though an attorney is not required 2 each party may present witnesses in his own behalf 3 each party has the right to cross examine all witnesses 4 only evidence presented before the hearing officer at such hearing may be considered in rendering the order e if the permit holder fails to appear at the hearing at the time place and date specified the city shall present sufficient evidence to establish a prima facie case showing that mechanical malfunction or faulty equipment has caused five or more false alarms in the 12month period immediately preceding the date of the notice of hearing f if the hearing officer finds that grounds exist for revocation of the permit for the alarm system he shall revoke such permit and shall give written notice to the permit holder of such revocation upon receipt of such notice the permit holder shall disconnect such alarm system immediately and shall surrender his permit to the tax assessor and collector or his designee g if the hearing officer does not find that grounds exist for revocation of the permit for the alarm system he shall give written notice of such finds to the permit holder    24 revocation of permit  subsequent inspection  application for new permit after a permit for an alarm system has been revoked the person in control of the property on which the alarm system is located may request that an inspection be made pursuant to section 10224 after the alarm system has been repaired such inspections shall be made by the city police department as soon as possible after receiving the request but in any event not later than ten regular working days after the person making the request has complied with section 10224 if upon such inspection it is found that the alarm system has been properly repaired the person in control of the property may apply for a new permit for such alarm system    25 request for inspection of alarm system a a person may request that the city make an inspection of the alarm system if 1 mechanical malfunction or faulty equipment has caused five or more false alarms in the 12month period immediately preceding such request  or 2 the permit for such system has been revoked b to request an inspection the person in control of the property shall submit to the tax assessor and collector    26 provisions regarding city response to alarm app a  b1   20 additional screening of real property scope a this article shall control the construction alteration replacement repair and location of fences and required screenings within the city limits b this article is hereby declared to be remedial and shall be construed to secure the beneficial interest and purpose thereof which are public health safety and general welfare of the community c a permit shall be required prior to the construction of any fence or screen in the city application for a permit shall be filed with the city secretary on such form as approved by the building official of the city a fee as provided for in the fee schedule shall be paid at the time the application is filed the application must be approved by the building official prior to and after construction  quality control quality control of materials and workmanship is not within the purview of this article except as it relates to the purposes stated within    material fences may be constructed of the following materials masonry cedar redwood treated lumber chainlink and decorative iron wooden fence material placed in contact with the earth shall be treated to protect the material from rot decay andor termites those materials not specifically mentioned are hereby prohibited unless approved in writing by the building official upon application barbed wire fencing may be allowed or used on parcels upon which large farm animals are legally kept and maintained and on parcels zoned heavy commercial and industrial permits are not required for internal crosssectioning of such land for the control of animals or to enforce rotational grazing    placement a fences shall be built on property lines to avoid conflicts between property owners in the event that there is a dispute between property owners of the location of a property line it shall be the responsibility of the property owners to resolve the conflict without intervention by the city b any fence built in or across utility easements shall remain the responsibility of the property owner in the event that the fence is constructed on an easement and the fence is subsequently damaged or destroyed exercise of the rights of the owner of the easement the repair or replacement of the fence shall be the sole responsibility of the property owner c fences and gates built in the front yard within the 25foot building setback where permitted shall not exceed four feet in height however on lots consisting of five or more contiguous acres one decorative arch or gate neither exceeding 20 feet in height nor 30 feet in width may be erected as a part of such a fence d fences built on a side yard shall be place on the property line 1 fences built on a side yard facing a public street may be placed on the property line when the side yard is adjacent to the adjoining propertys front yard the side yard fences may not exceed four feet in height unless they are set back to the adjoining properties front yard setback line 2 any fence in the rear yard of lots that contain a 25foot building setback in the rear portion of the lot shall not exceed four feet in height  zoning fences constructed in areas zoned a shall not exceed seven feet in height measured from finished grade fences constructed in all other zoned areas shall not exceed eight feet in height measured from finished grade  screening a where the side rear or service side of property zoned d e f g or h is adjacent to property zoned a b or c screening of not less than six feet in height shall be erected separating the use from a b or c property screening shall be erected as the property is developed for use screening shall meet the requirements of one of the listed alternates a b or c as set forth in section 10248 no screening shall be required adjacent to a street b for all uses other than a b or c refuse storage areas shall be visually screened by a sixfoot high solid fence or wall on all sides except the side used for pick up service such side need not be screened  standards for screening where screening is required the following are the approved types of screening 1 screening alternate a screening alternate a consists of a solid masonry or concrete wall six feet in height measured from the average grade of the nearest property line to that on which the screening is required 2 screening alternate b screening alternate b consists of a chainlink fence with redwood slats six feet in height measured from the average grade of the nearest property line of the property adjacent to that on which the screening is required 3 screening alternate c screening alternate c consists of a solid wood fence six feet in height measured from the average grade of the nearest property line of the property adjacent to that on which screening is required  maintenance all required screening shall be kept in good repair and maintained in a neat and orderly manner at all times the duty of maintenance shall be the responsibility of the person in charge and control of the property where screening is required  additional screening or fencing the planning and zoning commission may recommend and the city commission may require screening or fencing requirements in any zoning case in addition to these requirements when the nature and character of surrounding or adjacent property dictate a need to require such devices in order to protect such property and to further provide protection for the general health welfare and morals of the community  penalty a any person who shall violate any provision of this article or fail to comply therewith or with any of the requirements thereof or who shall erect construct alter or repair or who has erected constructed altered or repaired a building or structure in violation of a detailed statement or plan submitted and approved thereunder or of a permit or certificate issued thereunder shall be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by a fine as provided for in the general penalty provision found in section 16 1 the owner of a building structure or premises where anything in violation of this article shall be placed or shall exist and an architect builder contractor agent person or corporation employed in connection therewith and who may have assisted in the commission of such violation shall each be guilty of a separate offense and upon conviction thereof shall be fined as therein provided 2 the imposition of the penalties therein prescribed shall not preclude the corporation counsel from instituting an appropriate action or proceeding to prevent an unlawful erection construction reconstruction alteration repair conversion maintenance or use or to restrain correct or abate a violation or to prevent the occupancy of a building structure or premises or to prevent an illegal act conduct business or use in or about any premises b any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this article upon conviction thereof in the municipal court shall be fined in any sum as provided for in the general penalty provision found in section 16 and each day such violation continues shall constitute a separate offense    secs 1025210280  reserved article ix  carports permits a as required for the construction erection or installation of any building or structure or parts of a building or structure there shall be required a permit issued by the building official of the city for the construction erection or installation of a carport b no permit for the construction erection or installation of a building or structure or parts of a building or structure shall be issued for the construction erection installation of a building or structure within the building setback lines as designated by the city c provided however that a carport may be erected in conjunction with a single or duplex residential dwelling unless prohibited by a subdivision deed restriction it is the duty of the applicant for the permit to determine if there exists any subdivision deed restrictions which prohibit the erection of the carport and by applying for the permit certifies to the city that such prohibition does not exist  construction standards carports which are permitted under this article may be constructed of wood or metal and shall be attached to the main structure but not have a continuation of the main roof with a flat roof and a pitch of onefourthinch on 12 inches towards the street the carport shall not have any ceiling openings accessible for storage area and shall be supported at its outermost end by not more than two stanchions poles with braces anchored in a manner approved by the building official and such shall not be placed nearer than five feet from any property line the horizontal portion of the carport framework shall be less than eight feet or more than 12 feet above grade natural ground elevation the stanchions supporting the carport shall be separated by not more than 20 feet wide and 20 feet long and the roof overhand shall not exceed two feet from the supporting stanchions on any side no carport shall be erected or attached to any carport permitted under this section  placement no permit for the construction erection or installation of a single or duplex residential building or structure or parts of such building or structure shall be issued for the construction erection or installation of such building or structure within five feet of any property line    secs 1028410314  reserved article x  antenna towers definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alteration means any modification replacement or reconstruction that increases the height or materially increases the dimension of a tower structure building official means the official or his assistants duly appointed by the city commission calendar days means any day including saturdays sundays and scheduled holidays designated by the city commission grade means the lowest point of elevation of the finished surface of the ground paving or sidewalk within the area between the building or structure and a line five feet from the building or structure height of building means the vertical distance above a reference datum measured to the highest point of the coping of a flat roof or to the deck line of mansard roof or to the average height of the highest gable of a pitched or hipped roof the reference datum shall be selected by either of the following whichever yields a greater height of building 1 the elevation of the highest adjoining sidewalk or ground surface within a fivefoot horizontal distance of the exterior wall of the building when such sidewalk or ground surface is not more than ten feet above the lowest grade 2 an elevation of ten feet higher than the lowest grade when the sidewalk or ground surface described in subsection 1 of this definition is more than ten feet above lowest grade the height of a stepped or terraced building is the maximum height of any segment of the building height of tower means the vertical distance between the finished grade at the base of the tower or the lowest point of contact with the building and the highest point of the tower structure excluding the antenna manufacturing or heavy industrial district pertains to the use of land as defined in the zoning ordinance monopole means a single slender and typically cylindrical vertical structure to which antennas are affixed public utility 1 the term public utility means any person company corporation cooperative corporation partnership or any combination thereof that is subject to both a municipal franchise agreement and the comprehensive regulatory system established by and defined in the texas public utility regulatory act that owns or operates for compensation equipment or facilities for a producing generating transmitting distributing selling or furnishing electricity  or b the conveyance transmission or reception of communications over a telephone system as a dominant carrier 2 the term public utility does not include as is defined in the public utility regulatory act telegraph services television stations radio stations community antenna television services general radio telephone services or radiotelephone services authorized under the public mobile radio services rules of the federal communications commission or private water companies residential pertains to the use of land for a residence as is defined in the zoning ordinance of the city residential lot means a lot or tract of land which is included within the residential or multiple family districts as defined in the zoning ordinance of the city tower or tower structure means a fixed freestanding or guyed uninhabitable structure not designed as a shelter or to be occupied for any use the term tower or tower structure includes but is not limited to any such structure supporting antennas that transmit or receive any portion of the electromagnetic spectrum of radio waves the following are by way of example but not limitation towers or tower structures guyed or freestanding monopole structures lattice or open framed structures antenna supports water towers and other similar selfsupporting trussed or open framed structures  permit required a an application for a tower permit shall be submitted to the building official and approved in accordance with the provisions of this article prior to the construction placement or alteration of any tower or tower structure as defined in this article and not specifically excluded herein that is located within the boundaries of the municipality b a tower permit shall not be required for any tower repaired replaced or modified with no resulting increase in height or dimension and any tower repaired replaced or modified in order to comply with the requirements of any statute regulation order or rule of the federal communications commission the federal aviation administration or any other federal state or other governmental agency or authority  exemptions this article does not apply to the following structures 1 church bell towers and religious symbols associated with a place of worship 2 tower structures less than 20 feet in height 3 monopole tower structures less than 30 feet in height 4 tower structures used primarily for the support of amateur and citizens band radio antennas and meeting subsection 2 of this section 5 tower structures that are attached to placed upon or constructed on top of a building provided that the height of the tower structure does not exceed ten feet or the height of the building upon which the tower is constructed whichever is less 6 tower structures on real property owned leased held or used or dedicated for use by a public utility for rendering its service such as tower structures being used primarily for the transmission of electrical power by a public utility or the conveyance of communications over a telephone wireline system operated by a public utility 7 high mast monopole structures built owned or maintained by the state department of transportation the county or the city 8 tower structures constructed or placed on land or other structures owned leased held or dedicated for use by the state department of public safety the county the city or other governmental entities or agencies which land or other structures are used by such governmental agencies which land or other structures are used by such governmental entity or agency primarily for rendering fire police or other public protection services notwithstanding that such tower structures may be used jointly by such governmental entity or agency and any other public or private person or entity for other and additional public or private purposes  location of towers a no antenna tower permit shall be approved or a building permit issued in any residential light commercial heavy commercial city or church property multiplefamily dwelling or mobile home districts all antenna towers as described herein are limited to the citys manufacturing or heavy industrial districts b no tower permit shall be approved or a building permit issued in the manufacturing or heavy industrial district unless the proposed tower is in compliance with the applicable provisions governing distance requirements which are as follows 1 the distance between the base of a single monopole tower constructed without guy wire attachments and all residential lots within a residential neighborhood must not be less than a 1 times the height of the tower structure if the height of that tower structure is over 60 feet but not over 90 feet  b two times the height of the tower structure if the height of that tower structure is over 90 feet but not over 105 feet  c 2 times the height of the tower structure if the height of that tower structure is over 105 feet but not over 120 feet  or d three times the height of the tower structure if the height of that tower structure is over 120 feet 2 the distance between the base of a lattice tower a guyed monopole tower or any other tower structure and all residential lots within a residential neighborhood must not be less than a three times the height of the tower structure if the height of that tower structure is over 45 feet but not over 85 feet  b three times the height of the tower structure if the height of that tower structure is over 85 feet but not over 120 feet  c four times the height of the tower structure if the height of that tower structure is over 120 feet but not over 150 feet  or d the lesser of 1 three times the height of the tower structure  or 2 one thousand five hundred feet if the height of that tower structure is over 150 feet c all tower permit applications submitted to the city shall include a survey which meets the minimum standards as set forth by the state board of professional land surveyors all properties within the required setback distance radius can use the distance of a straight horizontal line from the center of the base of the tower to the nearest outside wall of the residential structure on the lot for the setback distance measurement all other distance measurements referred to in this section except for those defined in subsection d of this section shall be the distance of a straight horizontal line from the center of the base of the tower to the radial tangent of the residential lot d if the tower is constructed attached to or placed on a building or similar structure built or designed primarily for the purpose of supporting the tower then subsection b of this section shall apply the survey provided by the applicant shall be measured from the horizontal distance between the radial tangent of the residential lot and the point on finished grade where a vertical line from the center of the base of the tower strikes the grade e a tower which is properly permitted under this article or which was in existence on the date of final passage of the ordinance from which this article is derived shall not be required to be removed or relocated in order to meet the minimum distance requirements of this article due to subsequent platting of a residential lot nearer to the tower than the distance requirements of this section however any alteration to existing tower structures shall require compliance with the applicable provisions of this article f property uses and distances referred to in this section shall be determined as of the date and time that the completed tower permit application is filed  tower security fence a the base of a tower must be completely enclosed by a fence wall or barrier which limits climbing access to such tower and any supporting systems lines wires buildings or other structures exemptions from compliance with this section are provided in subsection d of this section b the fence wall or barrier required by subsection a of this section shall not be less than eight feet in height with no openings holes or gaps larger than four inches measured in any direction c gates and doors allowing direct access to the tower and enclosed by a fence wall or barrier as required by this section shall be equipped with a lock to keep and cable of keeping such doors or gates securely closed and locked at all times d the requirements of this section do not apply to 1 any tower located on a building that is not designed or built primarily to support the tower provided that the general public has no physical access to the tower  or 2 existing tower sites having security fences at least six feet in height  application procedures for permit a an application for a tower permit shall be submitted to the building of this article shall be punishable upon conviction by a fine of not less than $10000 or more than $200000 each day such violation continues shall constitute a separate offense all authority granted to the city attorney building official zoning commission and their designees under this article shall be exercised uniformly on behalf of and against all citizens and property of the city b if the building official or one of his designees makes a determination that a violation exists a notice to comply shall be served on the owner or operator of the tower structure the notice to comply shall be served as provided in subsection e of this section c after the expiration of ten days from the date on which the notice to comply is served the building official or his designee shall inspect the tower structure and site described in the notice if the violation no longer exists then the building official shall make a record of his findings close the matter and take no further action if the violation has not been abated corrected or in the process of being corrected then he shall cause to be issued to the owner or operator of a tower structure a citation informing the violator of the specific provision of this article that is being violated describing the condition causing the violation and requiring the violator to appear before a magistrate d each notice to comply must contain the following information 1 that the building official has made a determination that a violation exists 2 the specific condition that constitutes a violation of this article 3 the specific provision of this article that is being violated 4 the street address or general description of the property upon which the tower structure that is in violation of this article is constructed 5 that the owner or operator receiving this notice must abate cease or correct the violation not later than the tenth day after the date on which this notice is served e the notice to comply shall be served on the owner or operator of a tower structure in the following manner 1 in person or by registered or certified mail return receipt requested  or 2 if the owner cannot be located or identified or otherwise refuses to accept service as provided in this subsection by posting a copy on the property upon which the tower structure exists and by publishing the notice to comply in a newspaper of general circulation in the county two times within seven consecutive days in the event service is accomplished pursuant to this subsection it shall be deemed that the notice to comply was served on the second day such notice is published in a newspaper of general circulation for purposes of calculating the passage of the tenday period provided by this section for compliance  city attorney authorized to 2  state law reference municipal authority to regulate sexually oriented businesses texas local government et seq purpose and intent it is the purpose of this article to regulate sexually oriented businesses to promote the health safety morals and general welfare of the citizens of the city and to establish reasonable and uniform regulations to prevent the continued concentration of sexually oriented businesses within the city the provisions of this article have neither the purpose nor effect of imposing a limitation or restriction on the content of any communicative materials including sexually oriented materials similarly it is not the intent nor effect of this article to restrict or deny access by adults to sexually oriented materials protected by the first amendment or to deny access by the distributors and exhibitors of sexually oriented entertainment to their intended market  definitions as used in this article the following terms phrases words and their derivations shall oriented businesses are classified as follows 1 adult arcades  2 adult bookstores or adult video stores  3 adult cabarets  4 adult motels  5 adult motion picture theaters  6 adult theaters  7 escort agencies  8 nude model studios  and 9 sexual encounter centers  license required a a person commits an offense if he operates a sexually oriented business without a valid license issued by the city for the particular type of business b an application for a license must be made on a form provided by the chief of police the application must be accompanied by a sketch or diagram showing the configuration of the premises including a statement of total floor space occupied by the business the sketch or diagram need not be professionally prepared but must be drawn to a designated scale or drawn with marked dimensions of the interior of the premises to the accuracy of plus or minus six inches applicants who must comply with section 14113 shall submit a diagram meeting the requirements of section 14113 c the applicant must be qualified according to the provisions of this article d if a person who wishes to operate a sexually oriented business is an individual he must sign the application for a license as applicant if a person who wishes to operate a sexually oriented business is other than an individual each individual who has a 20 percent or greater interest in the business must sign the application for a license as applicant each applicant must be qualified under section 1499 and each applicant shall be considered a licensee if a license is granted e the fact that a person possesses a valid license for any other type of business does not exempt him from the requirement of obtaining a sexually oriented business license  issuance of license a the chief of police shall approve and issue any license required hereunder to an applicant within 30 days after receipt of an application unless the chief of police finds one or more of the following to be true 1 an applicant is under 18 years of age 2 an applicant or an applicants spouse is overdue in payment to the city of taxes fees fines or penalties assessed against or imposed upon the applicant or the applicants spouse in relation to a sexually oriented business 3 an applicant has failed to provide information reasonably necessary for issuance of the license or has falsely answered a question or request for information on the application form 4 an applicant or an applicants spouse has been convicted of a violation of a provision of this article other than the offense of operating a sexually oriented business without a license within two years immediately preceding the application the fact that a conviction is being appealed shall have no effect 5 the license fee required by this article has not been paid 6 an applicant has been employed in a sexually oriented business in a managerial capacity within the preceding 12 months and has demonstrated an inability to operate or manage a sexually oriented business premises in a peaceful and lawabiding manner thus necessitating action by law enforcement officers 7 an applicant or the proposed establishment is in violation of or is not in compliance with sections 14101 14106 14107 14109 14110 14111 14112 14113 or 14114 8 an applicant or an applicants spouse has been convicted of a crime a involving 1 any of the following offenses as described in texas penal  i prostitution  ii promotion of prostitution  iii aggravated promotion of prostitution  iv compelling prostitution  v obscenity  vi sale distribution or display of harmful material to a minor  vii sexual performance by a child  or viii possession of child pornography 2 any of the following offenses as described in texas penal  i public lewdness  ii indecent exposure  iii indecency with a child  iv sexual assault or aggravated sexual assault as described in texas penal   v incest solicitation of a child or harboring a runaway child described in texas penal   or vi criminal attempt conspiracy or solicitation to commit any of the foregoing offenses b for which 1 less than two years have elapsed since the date of conviction or the date of release from confinement imposed for the conviction whichever is the later date if the conviction is a misdemeanor offense  2 less than five years have elapsed since the date of conviction or the date of release from confinement for the conviction whichever is the later date if the conviction is of a felony offense  or 3 less than five years have elapsed since the date of the last conviction or the date of release from confinement for the last conviction whichever is the later date if the convictions are of two or more misdemeanor offenses or combination of misdemeanor offenses occurring within any 24month period b the fact that a conviction is being appealed shall have no effect on the disqualification of the applicant or applicants spouse c an applicant who has been convicted or whose spouse has been the license if granted shall state on its face the name of the person to whom it is granted the expiration date and the address of the sexually oriented business the license shall be posted in a conspicuous place at or near the entrance to the sexually oriented business so that it may be easily read at any time  fees the annual fee for a sexually oriented business license shall be as provided occupied or open for business c the provisions of this section do not apply to areas of an adult motel which are currently being rented by a customer for use as a permanent or temporary habitation peaceful and lawabiding manner thus necessitating action by law enforcement officers  revocation a the chief of police shall revoke a license if a cause of suspension in section 14103 occurs and the license has been suspended within the preceding 12 months b the chief of police shall revoke a license if he determines that 1 a licensee gave false or misleading information in the material submitted required under section 1499a8b has elapsed  appeal if the chief of police denies the issuance of a license or suspends or revokes a license the chief of police shall send to the applicant or licensee upon the business premises upon receipt of written notice of the denial suspension or revocation the licensee whose application for a license has been denied or whose license has been suspended or revoked shall have the right to appeal to the board of adjustment of the city the filing of an appeal stays the action of the chief of police in suspending denying or revoking a license until the court must be filed within 30 days after the receipt of notice of the decision of the board of adjustment the licensee shall bear the burden of proof in court  transfer of license a licensee shall not after a license has expired or has been revoked  appeal from locational restrictions a if the chief of police denies the issuance of a license to an applicant because the location of the sexually oriented business establishment is in violation of section 14107 then the applicant may not later than ten calendar days after receiving notice of the denial file with the chief of police a written request for an exemption from the locational restrictions of section 14107 b if the written request is filed with the chief of police within the ten day limit the board of adjustment shall consider the request the board shall set a date for the hearing within 60 days from the date the written request is received c a hearing by the board may only proceed if all the board members are present the board shall hear and consider evidence offered by any interested person the formal rules of evidence do not apply d the board may in its discretion grant an exemption from the locational restrictions of section 14107 if it makes the following findings 1 that the location of the proposed sexually oriented business will not have a detrimental effect on nearby properties or be contrary to the public safety or welfare  2 that the granting of the exemption will not violate the spirit and intent of this article  3 that the location of the proposed sexually oriented business will not downgrade the property values or quality of life in the adjacent areas or encourage the development of urban blight  4 that the location of an additional sexually oriented business in the area will not be contrary to any program of neighborhood conservation nor will it interfere with any efforts of urban renewal or restoration  and 5 that all other applicable provisions of this article will be observed e the board shall grant or deny the exemption by a majority vote failure to reach a majority of the members shall be necessary to affirm modify or reverse any decision disputes of fact shall be decided on the basis of a preponderance of the evidence the decision of the board is final f if the board grants the exemption the exemption is valid for one year from the date of the boards action upon the expiration of an exemption the sexually oriented business is in violation of the locational restrictions of section 14107 until the applicant applies for and receives another exemption g if the board denies the exemption the applicant may not reapply for an exemption until at least 12 months have elapsed since the date of the boards action h the grant of an exemption does not exempt the applicant from any other provisions of this article other than the locational restrictions of section 14107  additional regulations for escort agencies a an escort agency shall not employ any person under the within ten hours from the time the room is rented he rents or subrents the same sleeping room again c for purposes of subsection b of this section the terms rent or subrent mean the act of permitting a room to be occupied for any form of consideration  regulations pertaining to the exhibition of sexually explicit films or videos a a person who operates or causes to be operated a sexually oriented
