this article is derived are determined to be true and correct and are hereby adopted as part of this article  3172015 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning herbal incense means aromatic plant material whether referred to as potpourri or otherwise that is distributed in a loose leafy powder or granular form or in a compressed block or blocks that can be crushed to result in a powder or granular form and can be placed into a pipe cigarette paper or other drug paraphernalia for purposes of ingestion by smoking inhaling or other method regardless of how the substance is labeled or marketed including but not limited to whether or not such product is labeled as not for human consumption illicit synthetic drug means 1 any vegetative material or herbal or plant material however constituted designed intended marketed manufactured or engineered that contains any quantity of a synthetic chemical or synthetic chemical compound that has no legitimate relation to the advertised use of the product 2 any vegetative material or herbal or plant material with packaging or labeling that indicates suggests or implies that the substance is a substitute for or otherwise mimics the pharmacological effects of marihuana marijuana a controlled substance or a controlled substance analogue as defined by texas health and safety 3 any vegetative material or herbal or plant material offered for sale or sold with verbal or written representations regarding the purpose methods use or effect of the substance that indicates suggests or implies that the substance mimics the pharmacological effects of marihuana marijuana a controlled substance or a controlled substance analogue as defined by texas health and safety  3172015 prohibition of illicit synthetic drug it shall be unlawful for any person to possess provide sell barter produce manufacture distribute or to offer display market or advertise for sale or purchase with the intent to provide sell barter produce manufacture or distribute or to offer display market or advertise for sale any illicit synthetic drug  3172015 failure to publicly display or label herbal incense a herbal incense offered for sale to the public must be publicly displayed at all times or representative packaging b all herbal incense offered for sale to the public must include a label listing each active ingredient  3172015 penalty a any violation of this article is a misdemeanor punishable upon conviction by a fine not to exceed $200000 each separate package container or other separate unit containing an illicit synthetic drug shall constitute a separate and distinct offense b any violation of this article is a misdemeanor punishable upon conviction by a fine not to exceed $200000 each separate package container or other separate unit containing any herbal incense shall constitute a separate and distinct offense c prosecution or conviction under this article is cumulative of and shall never be a bar to any other civil or administrative remedy provided or allowed in this article or by law  3172015 affirmative defenses a it is a defense to prosecution under the provisions of this article that the person possessed the illicit synthetic drug under the lawful supervision of an authorized law enforcement officer to enforce or ensure compliance with this article b it is a defense to prosecution that a violation of this article is expressly permitted by state or federal law  3172015 seizure any product or substance possessed provided sold bartered produced manufactured distributed or offered displayed marketed or advertised for sale or purchased with the corporate limits of the city  purpose and intent it is the intent and purpose of this chapter to establish the reasonable orderly and effective display of outdoor advertising on all highways streets and roads in the corporate limits of the city  superiority clause if any subdivision or individual tract of land contains restrictions or covenants relating to signs or any person enter into a legally the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning advertising means to seek the attraction of or to direct the attention of the public to any goods services or merchandise whatsoever or a location that provides goods services or merchandise alterations or repair to an advertising display means repairs or improvements to a display sign or sign structure not exceeding 50 percent of its replacement value banner means any piece of cloth plastic canvas or similar material on which there appears a display typically supported at both ends business means the erection or use of any property building or structure permanent or temporary for the primary purpose of conducting in said building or structure or on said property a legitimate commercial enterprise in compliance with all ordinances and regulations of the city governing such activity business purpose shall not include any property building or structure erected or used for the primary purpose of securing a permit or erecting a sign display means the message of any sign whether it is in words the intersection of streets driveways alleys or any two surfaces intended for motor vehicles interstate and freeway primary system means the portion of the national system of interstate and defense 3 united states as amended nameplate means a nonelectrical sign identifying only the name and occupation or profession of the occupant of premises on which the sign is located and not exceeding six inches by 18 inches nonfreeway primary system means that portion of the connective main highway located within the state which now or hereafter may be designated the primary system by the state highway and public transportation commission and approved pursuant to title 23 united states as amended owner means the person who owns or leases the onpremises sign the owner of the offpremises sign or the owner of the real property on which the sign whether it is onpremises or offpremises is located person means an individualcompany corporation partnership association or any other entity primarily residential area means the rightofway and adjoining property area between two intersecting public streets in which a majority of the total front footage is used for residential purposes means the repair of a sign and its structure that has fallen or has been blown down or the repairs amount to a sum in excess of 50 percent of its replacement value registration means the registration of the currently existing nonpermitted signs relocate means the removal of a sign and any supporting structure from one location and placing it or its replacement at a new location residential town homes patio homes and apartments  property used for hotel motels and boardinghouses shall not be considered as used for residential purposes property devoted to both residential and nonresidential use shall be considered as used for residential purposes rightofway means the property fronting or immediately adjacent to and on either side of a public street or a nonpublic street visual acuity  or simply stated it can be seen  sign classifications a site classification for the purpose of this chapter signs shall be first classified as either an onpremises sign or an offpremises sign 1 onpremises sign the term onpremises sign means any sign identifying or advertising a business person or activity installed and maintained on the same premises as the business person or activity 2 offpremises sign the term offpremises sign means any sign displaying advertising copy that pertains to a business person organization activity event place service or product not principally located or primarily manufactured or sold on the premises of which the sign is located b type classification all signs shall further be classified into one of the following type signs 1 ground sign the term ground sign means a sign which is supported by uprights or braces in or upon the ground including monument signs two pole monument signs converted portable signs and portable signs 2 marquee sign the term marquee sign means a projecting sign attached to or hung from a canopy or covered structure projecting from and supported by a frame or pipe support extending beyond a building 3 monument sign the term monument sign means either a monument sign or enlarged monument sign as follows a monument sign the term monument sign means any sign ten feet or less in height as measured from the natural ground level to the top of the sign such sign shall be a maximum of 60 square feet on each side contain no cutouts from the ground to the top and shall be permanently affixed to the ground b enlarged monument sign the term enlarged monument sign means any sign 12 feet or less from the natural ground level to the top of the sign such sign shall be six feet of nonadvertisement and contain no cutouts from the ground to the bottom of the advertising and shall be permanently affixed to the ground 4 projecting sign the term projecting sign means any sign which is affixed to any building wall or structure and extends beyond the building wall or structure more than 12 inches 5 roof sign the term roof sign means any sign erected constructed or maintained above or upon the roof of any building 6 wall sign the term wall sign means any sign affixed to or painted upon the wall of any building 7 flag sign the term flag sign means any sign constructed of cloth canvas light fabric or material affixed to a building wall fence or on a staff or pole set in a concrete foundation 8 awning sign the term awning sign means any sign made of cloth metal or plastic with a metal frame attached to a building and projecting over a sidewalk thoroughfare or parking area when the same is so erected as to permit its being raised to a position flat against the building when not in use 9 canopy sign the term canopy sign means any sign other than an awning attached to a building projecting over a thoroughfare sidewalk or parking area and not erected so as to permit its being raised to a flat position against the building does not permit use of marquee letters and is commonly supported by poles or uprights set upon the underlying ground 10 multiple business sign the term multiple business sign means that type of sign that is a single structure but has a different display for each different business such as may be found at a shopping center 11 improved portable sign the term improved portable sign mean any onpremises portable sign converted to a fixed sign c special function classification any onpremises or offpremises sign of any type may also be included within one or more of the following additional classifications according to the special functions of that sign 1 electrical sign the term electrical sign means any sign containing electrical wiring or utilizing electric current but not including signs illuminated by a light source exterior to the sign structure 2 portable sign the term portable sign means any sign designed or constructed to be easily moved from one location to another including signs mounted upon a motor vehicle or designed to be mounted upon a trailer bench wheeled carrier or other nonmotorized mobile structure a portable sign with the wheels removed shall still be considered a portable sign hereunder for the purpose of this chapter trailer signs and signs on benches are portable signs 3 spectacular sign the term spectacular sign means any sign which has any automatically changing advertising which is equipped with glaring or rotating strobe or spotlights or which has any moving message whatsoever 4 temporary sign the term temporary sign means any sign including a banner constructed of cardboard wallboard or other light materials not to exceed 12 square feet in size further a temporary sign is intended to be used for a specific period of time not to exceed 30 days and then removed a portable sign and flag sign shall not be considered a temporary sign 5 moveable sign the term moveable sign means signs of six square feet or less designed to be moved by hand and normally stored inside the building during the nighttime 6 emitting sign the term emitting sign means any sign or symbol that emits any noise chemical substance or odor  sign administration and enforcement a sign administrator the mayor shall appoint or shall designate a sign administrator to administer and enforce the terms and conditions of this chapter and all other provisions of the laws relating to signs the sign administrator is empowered to delegate the duties and powers granted to and imposed upon him by this chapter to other persons serving under the sign administrator the sign administrator and such other persons shall constitute the sign administration section the sign administrator is directed to enforce and carry out all provisions of this chapter b enforcement responsibility the duties of the sign administrator shall include not only the approval of issuance of permits as required by this chapter but also the responsibility of insuring that all signs comply with this chapter and all other applicable law and that all signs for which a permit is required do in fact have a permit the sign administrator shall make such inspections as may be necessary and initiate appropriate actions to bring about compliance with this chapter and other applicable laws if such inspection discloses any instance of noncompliance the sign administrator shall investigate thoroughly any complaints of alleged violations of this chapter c powers of the sign administrator the sign administrator shall have the power and authority to administer and enforce the conditions of this chapter and all other laws relating to signs included among such powers are the following specific powers 1 inspection and approval every sign for which a permit is required shall be subject to the inspection and approval of the sign administrator when deemed advisable by the sign administrator a sign may be inspected at the point of manufacture if such point is within or adjacent to the city limits 2 warranties search upon presentation of proper identification to the owner agent or tenant in charge of such property he will admit the sign administrator or his representative to the premises to inspect said premises concerning the sign the applicant owner or other person in charge of the premises where the sign is located agrees by making application for a sign or renewal for a sign permit to admit the sign administrator or representative for the purposes of inspecting and investigating signs or sign structure any building structure or other premises or property between the hours of  am and  pm mondays   provided however that in cases of emergency where extreme hazards are known to exist which may involve imminent injury to persons loss of life or severe property damage and where the owner agent or tenant in charge of the property is not available after the sign administrator has made a good faith effort to locate same the sign administrator may enter the aforementioned structures and premises at any time upon presentation of proper identification to any other person on the premises 3 stop work order when the sign administrator or his representative discovers that a sign is being constructed not in conformance with this chapter he shall issue a stop work order to the person known to be so engaged upon notice and issuance of a stop work order from the sign administrator work on any sign being conducted in a manner contrary to the provisions of this chapter or being conducted in a dangerous or unsafe manner shall be immediately stopped such notice and order shall be in writing and shall be given to the owner of the property to his agent or to the person doing the work and shall state the conditions under which work may be resumed where an emergency exists written notice shall not be required to be given by the sign administrator the stop work order shall contain a notice of the right to appeal as provided herein work shall not resume until the condition causing the stoppage is corrected to the sign administrators satisfaction or the appeal process results in a reversal of the administrators stop work order 4 permit and license revocation the sign administrator shall have and is hereby granted the power and the authority to revoke any and all licenses or permits authorized by this chapter for violation of the terms and provisions of this chapter 5 appeal procedure upon revoking such license or permits the sign administrator shall notify by certified mail with return receipt requested to the address given by the permutes or licensee on the application for such permit or license to advise the permutes or licensee of such revocation and notify the permutes or licensee that the revocation will become final if not appealed to the sign appeals committee within ten days 6 establish procedures the sign administrator shall have the authority to adopt procedures  appeals to city commission any person wishing to appeal a decision of the sign administrator on the grounds that the decision misconstrues or wrongly interprets this chapter may within ten days after personally deliver to the city secretary or deposit that notice in the united states mail addressed to the city secretary within the said tenday period  violations and penalties a standards 1 general any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall upon conviction by court of competent jurisdiction thereof be punished by a fine in accordance with the general penalty provision found in section 16 each day in which any violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense in addition the city attorney is hereby authorized to take all actions both legal and equitable necessary to ensure compliance with this chapter 2 real property owner any person who is the owner of the real property upon which an onpremises or offpremises sign is located and who shall permit a violation upon such real property of any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall upon conviction by a court of competent jurisdiction thereof be punished by a fine in accordance with the general penalty provision found in section 16 for each violation each day on which any violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense in addition the city attorney is hereby authorized to take all actions both legal and equitable necessary to ensure compliance with this chapter b subterfuge any permit secured before or after the effective date of this chapter which in the opinion of the sign administrator has been secured not in full compliance with the provisions of this chapter may be revoked by the sign administrator c denial of entry for inspection whenever the sign administrator or his representative after showing proper identification is denied admission to inspect any premises the sign administrator may revoke all sign permits d work done without a permit any person firm or organization installing erecting or reconstructing a sign or changing the location of a sign without a proper permit will be assessed an amount twice the applicable permit fees in addition to any penalties civil or criminal which may be assessed as a result of a violation of the terms of this chapter e illegal political campaign signs no political campaign signs of any description shall be allowed on publicly owned property or the property of a public utility all political campaign signs posted on private property shall be posted only with the consent of the owner or lessee of such property  sign applications permits and fees a application procedure applications for permits required by this chapter shall be made upon the license application of any person who has committed such violation  sign maintenance and removal a maintenance 1 the area around any sign location must be maintained and kept clean by the owner grass will be cut a minimum of six feet from said billboard on all sides and entirely to the street curb on the side nearest the street and debris etc will be removed at least weekly 2 all signs shall be thoroughly painted as often as is necessary unless of galvanized or noncorroding metal or treated with appropriate wood preservative and shall be kept in good repair consistent with good maintenance all braces bolts clips supporting frame and fastenings shall be free from deterioration termite infestation rot or loosening all signs shall be able to withstand safely at all times the wind pressures specified elsewhere in this chapter in case any sign is not so maintained the sign administrator shall give written notice to the owner or lessee thereof to so maintain the signs or to remove the sign nonmaintenance shall be considered a misdemeanor and penalty shall be assessed accordingly b unsafe signs should any sign in the opinion of the sign administrator become insecure or in danger of falling or otherwise unsafe the sign administrator shall give written notice of the condition of the sign to the person owning leasing or responsible for the sign said person so notified shall correct the unsafe condition of the sign in a manner to be approved by the sign administrator in conformity with the provisions of this chapter c unlawful signs in case any sign shall be installed erected constructed or maintained in violation of any of the terms of this chapter in addition to any other rights and remedies provided herein the sign administrator shall give written notice to the owner lessee or person responsible for said sign ordering said owner lessee or person to alter the sign such that it complies with this chapter or to remove the sign d removal of signs 1 removal of unlawful signs by the city the following procedures will be followed by the city in removal of unlawful signs by the city a signs found on public property all signs found on public property or public utility property or easement may be removed and discarded by the city without notice to the owner this removal does not relieve the owner of any penalties b portable signs found on public property 1 the owners of portable signs that have the proper identification on them found on public property or public utility property or easement may be removed by the city and stored for ten days after the notice or removal is received by the owner for the owner to reclaim if not reclaimed within ten days the sign may be sold at auction or disposed of by the city the cost to reclaim shall be the sum of the following i a civil penalty  ii actual cost of removal and hauling minimum $5000  iii storage fee charged per day per 160 square feet of storage surface  and iv the cost of the employees time to administer such confiscation 2 the amounts of the abovelisted costs and fees shall be as determined and established by the city commission from time to time c other signs removed by city 1 all other signs removed by the city under any provision of this chapter shall be stored for ten days after the notice of removal is issued to the last known address of the owner of the sign or the owner is personally notified if such sign is not reclaimed by the owner within ten days of such notice the sign may be sold at auction or disposed of by the city the cost to reclaim shall be the sum of the following i a civil penalty  ii actual cost of removal and hauling minimum $5000  iii storage fee charged per day per 160 square feet of storage surface  and iv the cost of the employees time to administer such confiscation 2 the amounts of the abovelisted costs and fees shall be as determined and established by the city commission from time to time e replacement or repair of sign 1 when any sign or a substantial part of it is blown down or otherwise destroyed or taken down or removed for any purpose other than maintenance operations or for changing the letters symbols or other matter on the sign it may not be replaced reerected reconstructed or rebuilt except in full conformance with the provisions and requirements of this chapter including but not limited to the requirement of obtaining a permit 2 for purposes of subsection e1 of this section a sign or substantial part of it is considered to have been destroyed if the costs of repairing the sign is more than 50 percent of the cost of replacing the sign exclusive of the pole or poles supporting the sign 3 the engineering specifications must receive final inspection and approval by the city sign administrator or his designee prior to setting 4 it is unlawful and a violation of this chapter to continue any work after having been verbally advised to stop work or given a stop work order by the city sign administrator or his designee 5 it is unlawful and a violation of this chapter to remove a stop work order issued by the sign administrator or his designee 6 in addition to all other type at the same location 7 whenever there is a change in ownership or use of the business premises upon which an onpremises sign is located any and all onpremises signs on such premises shall be made to conform to all applicable requirements of this chapter  prohibited use of signs a signs not to be posted on or to public property it shall be unlawful for any sign other than official signs erected by the city county independent school district state or railway company to be placed or caused to be placed painted printed posted or affixed in any manner any picture bill sign or other advertising matter whatsoever on any curb sidewalk pavement telephone pole electric pole traffic signal standard or pole or other public improvement in any public street or grounds or upon any bridge overpass underpass or parts of the same median esplanade road rightofway or public utility easement traffic island or public building structure or erection of any type belonging to the city b no sign shall resemble an official sign no sign shall be constructed which resembles any official marker erected by the city state or any governmental agency or which by reason of position shape or color would conflict with the proper functioning of any traffic sign signal or which by its shape or color would conflict with or be confused with emergency vehicle lights especially blinking lights use of words such as stop look or danger or any other word phrase symbol or character in such a manner as to interfere with mislead or confuse traffic is prohibited c sign not to interfere with official signs signs may not be located or illuminated in such a manner as to obscure or otherwise interfere with the effectiveness of an official traffic sign signal or device or so as to obstruct or interfere with the view of a driver or approaching emerging or intersection traffic all such signs shall comply with the provisions of this chapter d proper shielding of lighted signals  interference with drivers of motor vehicles signs containing lights which are not effectively shielded as to prevent beams or rays of light from being directed at any portion of the traveled way from which the sign is primarily viewed and which are of such intensity or brilliance as to cause glare or to impair the vision of the driver of any motor vehicles or which otherwise interfere with any drivers operation of a motor vehicle are prohibited e spectacular signs the following types of spectacular signs shall be deemed prohibited 1 signs with strobe rotating strobe or blinking strobe lights 2 signs with flashing spotlights or blinking spotlights shall not be operated in a capacity which will interfere with traffic 3 automatically changeable advertising signs with more than one message which changes every three seconds 4 flashing lights with bulbs of greater than 15 watts 5 spectacular signs placed perpendicular to the roadway with the exception of automatically changeable advertising as regulated above f signs not to obstruct egress 1 no sign shall be erected constructed or maintained so as to obstruct any means of egress or any opening necessary for required light ventilation or fire fighting or for escape from the premises or so as to prevent free passage from one part of a roof to any other part thereof 2 no sign shall be attached to any exterior stairway fire escape fire tower balcony or balcony serving as a horizontal exit 3 no sign shall be erected constructed or maintained so as to interfere with the operation of a counterbalanced section of a fire escape and no projecting sign shall be erected constructed or maintained without a minimum of seven feet of clearance over any such counterbalanced section 4 no sign shall obstruct the free use of any window above the first story g emitting signs prohibited no emitting sign shall be permitted and are strictly prohibited at any location within the city h signs employing motion picture machines no sign shall employ a stereopticon or motion picture machine i signs not to create easements no permit for a sign extending beyond private property onto a public street public sidewalks or public alley shall constitute a permanent easement and every such permit shall be revocable at any time by action of the city commission the city shall not be liable for any damages to the owner by reason of such revocation the only time such a permit shall be issued shall be in the case of a projecting sign extending over a public sidewalk when such sidewalk abuts the front of the building to which the projecting sign is attached nor shall any sign by virtue of its longevity create an interest in real property by limitations or otherwise j vision restrictions prohibited any sign that restricts vision necessary for safety is prohibited if such a sign is erected and it does restrict vision so as to be a safety hazard it will be removed or modified to correct such restriction and eliminate the hazard it is the responsibility of the person owning and erecting the sign to ensure that the sign does not create such a hazard the following are guidelines to construction to prevent such restrictions of vision 1 any sign over pedestrian traffic shall be no lower than eight feet above the pedestrian surface 2 any sign over passenger vehicle traffic shall be no lower than ten feet above the vehicular traffic surface 3 any sign over general vehicular traffic shall be no lower than 14 feet six inches above the traffic surface 4 any sign which obstructs vision within the sight triangle k obscene signs prohibited  no obscene sign shall be permitted  onpremises and offpremises sign regulations a general requirements 1 no sign in sight triangle all ground signs discussed in this section shall not be placed in the sight triangle as defined herein and shall not be placed in or extend into a public street easement or rightofway 2 shall not obstruct view no sign shall in any way obstruct the view of traffic over the sight triangle or as defined in this chapter 3 roof sign clearance roof signs must have one foot of open space between the roofline and the bottom of the sign and three feet of open space shall be required between the sign structure and the edge of the roof and between sign structures b height restrictions no billboard may be erected that exceeds an overall height of 22 feet excluding cutouts extending above the rectangular border measured from the highest point on the sign to the ground level of the ground a roof sign may not at any point exceed 25 feet above the roof level c face restrictions 1 no business may have more than five faces per onpremises location except for wall signs for signs on a doublefaced backtoback foursided or vtype nature each face is considered a separate sign in computing the face area a curved surface sign shall be considered as three faces and a circular sign shall be considered as four faces those five signs may not exceed in total face area the greater of a three hundred square feet  or b one percent of the total useable square feet of the building plus one square foot for each linear foot of frontage on the adjacent streets the total area of all wall signs shall not exceed 20 percent of the area of the wall of building below roofline 2 no offpremises billboard shall exceed 672 square feet plus cutouts as herein provided d size and quantity of types restrictions total number of onpremises signs allowed at any one business shall not exceed five except for wall signs the maximum of the individual types of categories of signs are as follows 1 one portable sign for not more than 60 days a year or one improved portable sign 2 one monument sign maximum of 60 square feet each side 3 two monument signs if the business has frontage on two roads with a total street frontage of 300 feet or more 4 one marquee sign 5 two canopy signs 6 one ground sign per separate street frontage e cutout areas permitted exclusions or appendages cutouts shall not exceed 20 percent of the total sign face area and shall not exceed five additional feet in height or three feet of additional width f spacing no offpremises sign will be placed within 1500 feet of another sign subject to the provisions hereof no onpremises pole sign shall be erected within 500 feet of a pole sign for the same business on the same street except each business within the limit of five signs shall be permitted one sign for each street frontage g movable signs movable signs in addition to all other regulations herein contained shall observe the following rules applicable to the installation and operation of moveable signs 1 the number of moveable signs allowed for the first street of frontage is one moveable sign 2 one additional moveable sign will be allowed for each additional street that adjoins the business h subdivision signs only one offpremises sign with the name of the subdivision and directions thereto will be permitted in addition to the one exempt sign for a residential subdivision situated within the city limits that has been approved by the city and duly platted and recorded in the records of the county the size of such sign inclusive of all sides shall not exceed a total of 70 square feet such sign is allowed for a maximum period of two years and shall be promptly removed at the end of the twoyear period if the subdivision is less than 95 percent sold the sign may be repermitted for two years i location no offpremises sign shall be located in a primarily residential area j relocation removal and construction 1 relocation of offpremises signs will be permitted only in the case of a governmental taking of the land used for the sign location and no compensation paid to the sign owner 2 the owner of the billboard or portable sign must obtain a site for relocation of the billboard or portable sign within one month of removal and construction or placement must be completed within 90 days thereafter 3 the city will only permit reconstruction if the sign proposed to be constructed will be in compliance with all the provisions of this chapter 4 removal of any sign may be required if in the opinion of the sign administrator the sign unnecessarily distracts motorists hinders the view of the natural landscape or although grandfatherered is still in too close of proximity to other signs k offpremises signs on private property no person shall place an offpremises sign on private property without the consent of the owner or agent for the owner of said private property further no person ordinance which is incorporated herein and made a part hereof for all purposes  structural requirements  generally and for specific signs a design 1 general a all sites and sign structures shall be designed and constructed to resist wind forces as specified in this section all bracing systems shall be designed and constructed to transfer lateral forces to the foundations for signs on building the dead and lateral loads shall be transmitted structural frame of the building to the ground in such manner as not to over stress any of the elements thereof b the overturning movement produced from lateral forces shall in no case exceed twothirds of the dead load resisting movement for all signs uplift due to overturning shall be adequately resisted by proper anchorage to the ground or to the structural frame of the building for all signs the weight of earth superimposed over footing may be used in determining the deadload resisting movement such earth shall be carefully placed and thoroughly compacted 2 wind loads all signs and sign structures shall be designed to resist wind loads as follows wind load pressures in pounds per square foot for all signs height above ground feet pressure poundsft2 050 30 5199 35 measured above the average level of the ground adjacent to the structure 3 vertical design loads vertical design loads except roof live loads shall be assumed to be acting simultaneously with the wind loads 4 working stresses all signs shall be designed to conform with the requirements of the any building and construction technical code as adopted by reference by the city in the building and construction chapter of this allowable working stresses the working strength of chains cables guys or steel rods shall not exceed onefifth of the ultimate strength of such chains cables guys or steel rods 5 registered engineers seal all commercially erected signs over 12 feet shall be approved by a professional registered engineer registered in the state and all plans shall contain the engineers seal b construction 1 general the supports for all signs or sign structures shall be placed in or upon private property and shall be securely built constructed and erected in conformance with the requirements of the any building and construction technical code as adopted by reference by the city in the building and construction chapter of this 2 materials materials for construction of all signs and sign structures shall be of the quality and grade as specified for buildings in the any building and construction technical code as adopted by reference by the city in the building and construction chapter of this any of those provisions to the contrary examples of approved sign face materials are lexan acrylic mdo duraply and luster 3 nonstructural trim nonstructural trim and portable display surface may be of wood metal approved plastics or any combination thereof consistent with any building and construction technical code as adopted by reference by the city in the building and construction chapter of this 4 anchorage members supporting unbraced signs shall be so proportioned that the bearing loads imposed on the soil in either direction horizontal or vertical shall not exceed the safe values load specified in subsection a2 of this section acting in any direction anchors and supports shall be designed for safe bearing loads on the soil and for an effective resistance to pull out amounting to a force 25 percent greater than the required resistance to overturning c electrical requirements all electrical fixtures equipment and appurtenances installed in conjunction with a sign shall be designed and installed in accordance with the city electrical code as it now exists or may hereinafter be amended d clearances 1 clearances from high voltage power lines signs shall be located a minimum distance of 12 feet measured horizontally and 12 feet measured vertically from overhead electrical conductors commonly called distributions lines and a minimum distance of five feet measured horizontally and five feet measured vertically from what are commonly called service drop lines the term electrical conductors as used in this subsection means any electrical conductor either bare or insulated installed above the ground 2 clearance from poles no sign shall be erected nearer than five feet horizontally or eight feet vertically from any telephone pole or cable pole or crossmember of that pole e exempt signs not exempt from this section no sign which is otherwise exempt is exempt from the provisions of this section fee requirements insurance and bonding requirements and all other provisions of this chapter applicable to ground signs unless a provision specifically includes or excludes a portable sign b homestead tax freeze for elderly or disabled people 1 there is hereby created and established a tax freeze on the amount of property taxes imposed by the city on the homesteads of disabled individuals or individuals age 65 or older which shall be governed by texas tax as follows a the tax freeze shall become effective beginning with the 2004 tax year and shall remain effective for each successive tax year until otherwise amended or repealed by the city commission or other appropriate authority b the total amount of ad valorem taxes imposed on the residence homesteads of a person who qualified that residence homestead for the exemption in accordance with the tax code as that of a person who is disabled or is 65 years of age or older shall not be increased while it remains the residence homestead of that person or that persons spouse who is disabled or 65 years of age or older c if the person who is disabled or is 65 years of age or older dies in a year in which the person received a residence homestead exemption the total amount of ad valorem taxes imposed on the residence homestead shall not be increased while it remains the residence homestead of that persons surviving spouse if 1 the surviving spouse is 55 years of age or older at the time of the persons death  2 the residence homestead of the deceased person is also the residence homestead of the surviving spouse on the date of the persons death  and 3 the residence homestead remains the residence homestead of the surviving spouse d notwithstanding anything contained herein taxes on the residence homestead may be increased to the extent the value of the homestead is increased by improvements other than repairs and other than improvements made to comply with governmental requirements e an improvement to property that would otherwise constitute an improvement is not treated as an improvement if the improvement is a replacement structure for a structure that was rendered uninhabitable or unusable by a casualty or by wind or water damage for purposes of appraising the property in the tax year in which the structure would have constituted an improvement the replacement structure is considered to be an improvement under that subsection only if 1 the square footage of the replacement structure exceeds that of the replaced structure as that structure existed before the casualty or damage occurred  or 2 the exterior of the replacement structure is of higher quality construction and composition than that of the replaced structure f a person may not receive freeze taxes for more than one residence homestead no matter where located in the same year a person may designate a new residence homestead within the city in accordance with the tax code 2 the limitation on taxes provided by this section unlawful for any person knowingly to fail to appear for the trial of any charge against such person pending in the corporation court of the city  unnecessary to deny exceptions etc in complaint or defense shall be on defendant  knowledge of ordinances it shall be the duty of every police officer to thoroughly acquaint himself with provisions of all of the traffic code and to assist all persons using the streets of the city to become acquainted and to comply therewith  enforcement of ordinances it shall be the duty of the police department of the city to enforce all of the terms and provisions of all ordinances and laws regulating traffic  special orders the chief of police or any police officer of the city in case of necessity or emergency or of congestion by traffic may make such special orders to pedestrians or to drivers of vehicles as in his judgment may be necessary to meet the emergency or relieve the congestion  arrest without warrant any police officer of the city shall have the power and is hereby authorized to arrest without a warrant of arrest being first issued any person who violates any ordinance of the city in the presence of or within the view of such arresting officer any such officer may also arrest without warrant any person whom said officer has probable cause to believe has recently committed a violation of any such ordinance    riding or driveways or streets grounds the term motor vehicles as used in this chapter means any vehicle which is or can be selfpropelled   art  street names a where a duplication exists in a streets name the city will change the name of that street where the least amount of people will be affected b approval of the county planning commission will be obtained before any change in a street name is adopted c where the street bears a number such as 1st street 2nd street and 3rd street or an alphabetical designation such as a street b street and c street where it is practical and possible a preface will be added to the name of said street in the city the streets will be known as galena a galena b and galena c or galena 1st galena 2nd and galena 3rd d any street which has been dedicated but not fully developed with a duplicated name will be changed immediately by the governing body e where two streets are connected and the two streets become one street then a single name will be given the two streets provided the streets are a continuation of each f before changing the names of any streets the city will request from the post office a recommendation as to such change g changes of identical duplications will be given priority for example where two streets are spelled the same the governing body will attempt to change these streets before changing two streets that are spelled differently but that are pronounced the same h the city commission recommends the placing of house numbers on the house and on the curbline   art  registration of bicycles a it shall be unlawful for any person to operate or use a bicycle propelled wholly or in part by muscular power upon any of the streets alleys or public highways of the city without first obtaining from the police department a license therefor b the police department is hereby authorized and directed to issue upon written application bicycle licenses and said licenses shall be issued for the calendar year commencing on january 1 of each of said calendar years and ending on december 31 of said calendar year said licenses when issued shall entitle the licensee to operate such bicycle for which said license has been issued upon all streets alleys and public highways exclusive of the sidewalks thereof in the city c the city shall provide each year metallic license plates and seals together with registration cards and holders therefor said metallic license plates and registration cards having numbers stamped thereon in numerical order beginning with number 1 and indicating the year for which the same are issued and the letters gpbl stamped thereon  such metallic license plates shall be suitable for attachment upon the frames of bicycles and it shall be the duty of the police department to attach one such metallic license plate to the frame of each bicycle and to issue a corresponding registration card to the licensee upon the payment of the license fee herein provided for such metallic license plate shall remain attached during the existence of such license the police department shall also keep a record of the date of issue of each license to whom issued and the number thereof d all persons engaged in the business of buying secondhand bicycles are hereby required to make daily report to the police department giving the name and address of the person from whom each bicycle is purchased the description of each bicycle purchased the frame number thereof and the number of the metallic license plate found thereon if any all persons engaged in the business of selling new or secondhand bicycles are hereby required to make a daily report to the police department giving a list of all sales made by such dealer which list shall include the name and address of each person to whom sold the kind of bicycle sold together with a description and frame number thereof and the number of the metallic license plate attached thereto if any e it shall be the duty of every person who sells or transfers ownership of any bicycle to report such sale or transfer by returning to the police department the registration card issued to such person as licensee thereof together with the name and address of the person to whom said bicycle was sold or transferred and such report shall be made within five days of the date of said sale or transfer it shall be the duty of the purchaser or transferee of such bicycle to apply for a transfer of registration therefor within five days of said sale or transfer f it shall be unlawful for any person to willfully or maliciously remove destroy mutilate or alter the number of any bicycle frame licensed pursuant to this section it shall also be unlawful for any person to remove destroy mutilate or alter any license plate seal or registration card during the time in which such license plate seal or registration card is operative provided however that nothing in this section shall prohibit the police department from stamping numbers on the frames of bicycles on which no serial number can be found or on which said number is illegible or insufficient for identification purposes g the annual license fee to be paid for each bicycle shall be as provided for in the fee schedule and shall be paid in advance all license fees collected under this section shall be paid into the general fund of the city h it shall be unlawful for any person to ride or propel a bicycle on the streets alleys and public highways of the city not equipped with lights or reflectors that cannot be seen at a distance of 100 feet during the night time    motor vehicle idling limitations it shall be unlawful for an owner or operator of a motor vehicle with gross vehicle weight rating of more than 14000 pounds operated within the city of galena park texas to cause or allow the engine of the vehicle to idle for more than five minutes when the vehicle is not in motion provide however it shall be an affirmative defense for which the underlying prohibited does not apply including 1 a vehicle that is equipped with a 2008 or subsequent model year heavyduty diesel engine or liquefied or compressed natural gas engine that has been certified by the united states environmental protection agency or another state environmental agency to emit no more than 30 grams of nitrogen oxides emission per hour when idling  2 a motor vehicle force to remain motionless because of traffic conditions over which the operator has no control  3 the engine of a motor vehicle that is being used to supply heat or air conditioning necessary for passengers comfort and safety in vehicles intended for commercial or public passengers transportation or passenger transit operations in which case idling up to a maximum of 15 minutes is allowed  4 the engine of a motor vehicle being used to provide air conditioning or heating necessary for employee health or safety in an armored vehicle while the employee remains inside the vehicle to guard the contents while the vehicle is being loaded or unloaded 5 the engine motor vehicle being used to provide air conditioning or heating necessary for employee health or safety while the employee is using the vehicle to perform an essential job function related to roadway construction or maintenance  6 the engine of a motor vehicle providing a power source necessary for mechanical operations other than propulsion andor passengers compartment heating or air conditioning  7 the engine of a motor vehicle being operated for maintenance or diagnostic purposes  8 the engine of a motor vehicle being operated solely to defrost a windshield  9 the engine of a motor vehicle being used as airport ground support equipment  10 the owner of the motor vehicle rented or leased to a person that operates the vehicle and is not employed by the owner  or 11 the motor vehicle when idling is necessary to power a heater or air conditioner while a driver is using the vehicles sleeper berth for governmentmandated rest period and is not within two miles of a facility offering external heating and air conditioning connections at a time when those connections are available  10202015 editors note  adopted oct 20 201 did not regulations it shall be unlawful and an offense for any person to perform any act forbidden or fail to perform any act required in this  obedience to police it shall be unlawful for any person to willfully fail or refuse to comply with any lawful order or direction of a police officer pertaining to the movement of traffic or pedestrians on the public streets whether given in person or by means of visible or audible signals  exemptions to authorized emergency vehicles a the provisions of this the operation parking and standing of vehicles shall apply to authorized emergency vehicles as defined in this article other than vehicles of the police and fire departments except as follows b a driver when operating any such vehicle in an emergency except when otherwise directed by a police officer may 1 park or stand notwithstanding the provisions of this   2 proceed past a red or stop signal or stop sign but only after slowing down as may be necessary for safe operation  3 exceed a maximum speed limit except as provided by an ordinance adopted under texas transportation as long as the operator does not endanger life or property  and 4 disregard regulations governing direction of movement or turning in specified direction so long as he does not endanger life or property c the foregoing exemptions shall not however protect the driver of any such vehicle from the consequences of his reckless disregard of the safety of others notwithstanding any other provision of this vehicles of the police and fire departments of the city while sounding a siren or bell shall have the rightofway over all other vehicles and at such times all ordinances and regulations pertaining to official traffic signals stop signs or official traffic control devices shall not apply to such police and fire department vehicles  persons propelling push carts or riding bicycles or animals to obey traffic regulations every person propelling any push cart or riding a bicycle or an animal upon a other than an alley in such a manner or under such conditions as to leave available less than ten feet of the width of the roadway for free movement of vehicular traffic except that a driver may stop temporarily during the actual loading or unloading of passengers or when necessary in obedience to traffic regulations or traffic signs or signals of a police officer no person shall park a vehicle within an alley in such a manner or under such conditions as to leave available less than ten feet of the width of the roadway for the free movement of vehicular traffic  parking prohibited during it shall be unlawful and an offense for any person or driver or owner to park or stand any vehicle or for any owner knowingly to suffer or permit any driver of any vehicle belonging to such owner to park or stand the same at the place and during the hours so designated except sundays and holidays and after  pm on any day  parking time limited in designated places when signs are erected or curbs or streets painted or parking meters installed giving notice of time limits for the parking of vehicles it shall be unlawful and an offense for a person to park a vehicle for a longer period of time than that designated on the signs streets or curb markings or parking meters  standing for loading only it is prohibited and shall be unlawful and an offense for a person to stop stand or park any vehicle for any purpose or period of time other than for the expeditious loading or unloading of passengers in any place marked as a passenger loading zone between the hours of  am and  pm of any day and then only for a period not to exceed two minutes except sundays and legal holidays it shall be unlawful for any person to park or stand any vehicle other than a commercial vehicle in any truck loading zone between the hours of  am and  pm no person shall park or stand any commercial vehicle in any truck loading zone between such hours except for the purpose of unloading and delivery or pickup and loading of materials in no case shall such stop exceed 30 minutes unless otherwise designated by appropriate signs or markings this section shall not apply on sundays or legal holidays  bus stops and taxicab stands the driver of a bus or taxicab shall not stand or park the vehicle operated by him upon any street in any business district at any place other than at a bus stop or taxicab stand respectively except that this provision shall not prevent the driver of any such vehicle from temporarily stopping in accordance with other stopping or parking regulations at any place for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading and unloading passengers no person shall stop stand or park a vehicle other than a bus in a bus stop or other than a taxicab in a taxicab stand when any such stop or stand has been officially designated and appropriately marked except for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading passengers when such stopping does not interfere with any bus or taxicab waiting to enter or about to enter such zone and in no case shall the driver of a vehicle leave the same while it is in such bus stop or taxicab stand  methods of standing or parking except when necessary in obedience to traffic regulations or traffic signs or signals or to avoid contact with another vehicle or a pedestrian the driver of any vehicle shall not stop stand or park such vehicle in a roadway other than parallel with the edge of the roadway headed in the direction of traffic and with the curbside wheels of the vehicle within 18 inches of the edge of the roadway and if in any parking meter zone such vehicle shall be parked with the hood of such vehicle alongside of or next to the parking meter  provided that other methods of parking than those above described shall be followed at places where such other methods are indicated by appropriate signs or markings  unlawful parking no person shall stand or park a vehicle upon any roadway for the principal purpose of 1 displaying it for sale 2 washing greasing repairing or dismantling such vehicle except for making repairs necessitated by the physical impossibility of removing such vehicle until such repairs have been made  stopping standing or parking prohibited in specified places no person shall stop stand or park a vehicle except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic or in compliance with the directions of a police officer or a traffic control device or marking at any of the following places 1 upon any street or at any place thereon at any time when signs are erected or markings established showing a loading zone unless it is a commercial vehicle and in this case only for the purpose of loading and unloading as provided in this article 2 in front of the entrance or exit of any theater hotel inn or depot for a space of 30 feet immediately in front of said theaters hotels inns or depots and ten feet immediately in front of all other exits thereof 3 within two blocks of any burning building or structure nor shall any vehicle be driven or operated within two blocks of any burning building or structure except to drive away from said burning building or when within four blocks of any burning building or structure to drive past either to the left or to the right of any vehicle except to drive away from said building these provisions however shall not apply to any member of the city fire department or police department or any city official when actually engaged in an official duty or to the owner or other person directly interested in the building or structure on fire or to the operators of public utility service cars and ambulances in the case of an emergency or to those persons who are assisting in the extinguishing of the fire or in salvage  vehicles backed to curb the driver of any horsedrawn vehicle backed to the curb for the purpose of loading or unloading is required to stand the horses parallel to the curb and headed in the direction of traffic when an articulated vehicle of six wheels or more is backed to the curb for the purpose of unloading or loading the front or tractor portion shall as far as physically possible be turned parallel to the curb and headed in the direction of traffic and the rear or trailer portion shall be parked at an angle to the curb of not more than 45 degrees  maximum time trucks and trailers to be parked onstreets it shall be unlawful for any person to leave stand or park a truck in excess of one ton and trailers either attached or unattached to a motor vehicle on the public streets of the city for a period of time in excess of two hours police are authorized and directed to have said vehicles towed away by private wreckers at the owners expense  continuous parking in excess of 24 hours it shall be unlawful for any person or any owner knowingly to leave standing in any public street alley or other public place any vehicle automobile wagon or other character of private property unattended for a longer continuous period of time than 24 hours  manner of stopping etc at curb no operator of a vehicle shall stop stand or park the same with its left side nearer to the curb than its right side except when it has been specifically provided otherwise on oneway streets now or hereafter designated  cutback curbs it shall be unlawful and an offense for any person to cut back any curb in front of any place or establishment for the purpose of providing individual parking space or parking space for the use of customers of such person without the consent of the city commission  provided that this article shall not apply where curbs heretofore have been cut back under authority granted by previous city ordinances and at such locations parking may be at a 27 degree angle to the curb but in no event shall any portion of a parked vehicle extend more than six feet into the roadway from the curbline as it would exist in the absence of such a cutback  and provided further that this article shall not be construed so as to prevent the owner or person in charge of any property from providing parking space for vehicles wholly on property owned or controlled by him if no part of the space thus provided includes any portion of the rightofway of a street and if such person otherwise complies with all valid ordinances of the city  owner and operator responsible for illegal parking it shall be unlawful for any person having registered in his name or owning or operating or having in charge any vehicle knowingly to allow or suffer or permit same to stop stand or be parked in any street in the city in violation of any of the ordinances of the city regulating the stopping standing or parking of vehicles  presumption of parking by owner when car illegally parked when any person is charged with having parked or left standing a vehicle on any street in the city at a place on said street where parking of vehicles is prohibited or with parking such vehicle on said street in a manner which violates the manner of parking a vehicle as designated or with parking such vehicle for a length of time in excess of that allowed in the space where said vehicle was parked proof that said vehicle was at the date of the offense alleged owned by the person charged with the offense shall constitute prima facie evidence that said vehicle was parked or left standing at the place charged by said owner but the owner shall have the right to introduce evidence to show that said vehicle was not parked by him as charged in the complaint in any proceeding where a person is charged with parking a vehicle on the streets of the city in violation of any ordinance of the city regulating the parking of vehicles a certified copy of the registration receipt issued by the assessor and collector of taxes of any county in the state shall be admissible in evidence for the purpose of proving that the license plate displayed on said vehicle at the time of the offense was issued to the person so charged and proof of such fact shall constitute a prima facie presumption that the vehicle was parked by the person to whom said registration receipt was practical and safe it shall be unlawful for the operator of any vehicle other than ambulances on emergency calls or vehicles of the fire and police departments to drive across or line of vehicles driver of any vehicle shall not turn such vehicle so as to proceed in the opposite direction upon any street in the downtown business district or at any signalized intersection or at those intersections where turns are prohibited by official signs or markings unless such turn is affirmatively authorized by an appropriate sign or signal the driver of any vehicle shall not upon any other street so turn a vehicle unless such movement can be made in safety and without interfering with other traffic and then only where a street is crossed or makes intersection with another street  emerging from and entering alley or private driveway the driver of a vehicle emerging from an alley driveway or building shall stop such vehicle immediately prior to driving onto a sidewalk or into the sidewalk area extending across any alleyway and upon entering the roadway shall yield the rightofway to all vehicles approaching on said roadway any vehicle emerging from an alley or private driveway in a business district shall proceed straight ahead or make a right turn it shall be unlawful and an offense to make a left turn upon emerging from or entering any alley or driveway in a business district  cutting corners it shall be unlawful and an offense to drive a vehicle over any sidewalk area and driveway parking lot or any business entrance at any intersection in making either seeking to hold a parade consisting of 12 or more people in or on a public place within the city shall file an application with the city secretary for a parade permit not less than ten days nor more than 30 days before the date upon which the parade is proposed to be conducted any person who participates in a parade that has not been issued a permit by the chief of police shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and fined in accordance with the general penalty provision found in section 16 b the term public place as used in this article means any road street alley or sidewalk within the city  manner in which to apply for permit any person desiring to acquire a permit to parade within the city may make application for such with the city commission of said city or their designees either in writing or verbally setting out the general purpose of said parade and the beginning point and point of termination of such and the route generally to be followed during said parade  standards for issuance the chief of police shall issue a parade permit when from a consideration of the application and from such other information as may otherwise be obtained it is found 1 the conduct of the parade will not substantially interrupt the safe and orderly movement of other traffic contiguous to its route or place of occurrence 2 the conduct of the parade will not require the diversion of so great a number of police officers of the city to properly police the line of movement or the place of occurrence and the areas contiguous thereto as to prevent normal police protection to the city 3 the conduct of such parade will not require the diversion of so great a number of ambulances and other emergency vehicles as to prevent normal ambulance and other emergency service to portions of the city other than that to be occupied by the proposed parade and areas contiguous thereto 4 the concentration of persons animals and vehicles at assembly points of the parade will not unduly interfere with police fire and other emergency services to areas contiguous to such assembly areas 5 the conduct of such parade will not interfere with the movement of fire fighting equipment en route to a fire 6 the conduct of the parade is not reasonably likely to cause injury to persons or property to provoke disorderly conduct or to create a disturbance 7 the parade is scheduled to move from its point of origin to its point of termination expeditiously and without unreasonable delays en route notice of rejection the chief of police shall act upon the application for a parade permit within three business days after the filing thereof if the chief of police disapproves the application he shall mail to the applicant within three business days after the date which the application was filed a notice of his action stating the reasons for his denial of the permit notice shall be deemed complete when mailed appeal procedure any person aggrieved shall have the right to appeal the denial of a parade permit to the mayor the appeal shall be taken within 60 days after notice the mayor shall act upon the appeal within 30 days after its receipts a 8162016 alternative permits the chief of police in denying an application for a parade permit shall be empowered to authorize the conduct of the parade on a date at a time or over a route or in a place different from that named by the applicant an applicant desiring to accept an alternate permit shall within five days after notice of the action of the chief of police file a written notice of acceptance with the chief of police an alternate parade permit shall conform to the requirements of and shall have the effect of a parade permit under this article secs 5423754265  reserved article ix  parking lots and offstreet parking parking lots introduction of pollutants into the citys wastewater facilities which 1 will interfere with the operation of the facilities or contaminate the resulting sludge  and 2 could pass facilities resulting in inadequately treated effluent into the receiving waters or the atmosphere or otherwise be incompatible with the sanitary sewer facilities c this article provides for the regulation of all contributors to the citys wastewater facilities and the enforcement of these general requirements authorizes monitoring and enforcement activities requires user reporting and provides for the setting of fees for the equitable distribution of costs resulting from the program established herein d this article shall apply to all users of the citys wastewater facilities whether such users are located within or outside the boundaries of the city except as otherwise provided herein the commission shall administer implement and enforce the provisions of this article    definitions unless the context
